paragraphs.text: Think that scenario is too harsh? Think again. That’s what brutal honesty does to people. Why? Feedback, criticism, etc, is often viewed as an attack. That has nothing to do with you. Most people are bad at receiving feedback. Again, we’re human beings. We don’t like it.
paragraphs.name: fc42

paragraphs.text: But we need you to make that happen.

paragraphs.name: 110e
paragraphs.text: Look, you can pretend it’s not about appearances at work, but it is. Looking busy and actually being busy are the same thing.

paragraphs.name: fc42
paragraphs.text: Think that scenario is too harsh? Think again. That’s what brutal honesty does to people. Why? Feedback, criticism, etc, is often viewed as an attack. That has nothing to do with you. Most people are bad at receiving feedback. Again, we’re human beings. We don’t like it.

paragraphs.name: fc42
paragraphs.text: Think that scenario is too harsh? Think again. That’s what brutal honesty does to people. Why? Feedback, criticism, etc, is often viewed as an attack. That has nothing to do with you. Most people are bad at receiving feedback. Again, we’re human beings. We don’t like it.
So please, prove me wrong and make change happen at your company. Because I hope that these truths become misconceptions in the future.

paragraphs.text: Great advice! This should be required reading for anyone entering the workforce. The concept of “work hard and it will pay off” is unfortunately not applicable in many corporate jobs. Those who “appear” to be the smartest and hardest working will typically be the winners. The only job where this doesn’t apply is if you are a producer. If you are in…

a3c7e276c6b5.title: Darius, At first I did not read to the end and I was thinking “I believe just the opposite.”

paragraphs.text: Darius, At first I did not read to the end and I was thinking “I believe just the opposite.” It’s a rare culture and place that foster the goodness we all have. However we can make this different, let’s all do our parts — from inside as intrepreneurs or from Outside as change agents. Thanks for speaking your truth and helping others be the change.

paragraphs.text: Wholeheartedly agree in setting boundaries between professional and personal life — but it doesn't have to suck the human heart out of you day-to-day experience! Self awareness of your concepts vs. how you approach each of the concepts can offer vastly different outcomes :)

paragraphs.text: Well said! One of my most favorite person on earth told me that, “There are no friends at work.” She also suggested that I keep chanting this inside my head whenever I feel that I am getting emotionally attached to certain colleagues. Sad but true :)

paragraphs.name: 2feb
paragraphs.text: The people who directly work with you can tell the difference. It’s possible to exaggerate your ‘brand’ within the company certainly by appearing to be better than you are, but if you don’t get stuff done, people will notice.

paragraphs.text: The looking busy part. I remember I was at a F500 a few decades ago (you can read my CV to piece it together) and this one field operations manager was promoted into a staff position where he oversaw special projects, etc. He was used to line authority where what you got done was more valued than how you did it.
